They don't really have a choice, unfortunately. Champions and reworks almost always needs to be released overtuned so they don't feel like complete shit while everyone is learning them. Release them weak or even balanced on release and people will suck ass at them and put Riot in a very unenviable position: Intentionally overbuff the champion to incentivize people to play and learn them and then nerf later on down the line or simply let the champion fade into irrelevance. They typically tend towards the former; Yasuo, Kalista, and Tahm are the best examples of this the last 2 years. But they've also opted for the second on occasion, with Illaoi being the best example. She's statistically been terrible since release but Riot has chosen not to buff her, and her playrate has dropped quite low as a result.

That was some terrible Sion plays though. He should have just retreated after killing the tower, forcing Shen to use dash to pursue. Once the dash is down Sion can do an easy E -> Q combo. Also, the new Shen with % health damage and a constantly refreshing shield with a theoretical 100% uptime looks to be a beastly duelist. Sion is more focused on aoe knockups/stuns. In that situation you could have swapped Sion for Alistar or Leona and the outcome would have been much the same.

Not saying Sion is in a perfect spot, but that video is a horrible argument in favor of buffing him.

Actually that's a perfect example of the state of Sion.

He's got massive counterplay, but the reward for landing his abilities is not commensurate to the potential people have to avoid his effects. He's got a very above average, average number of games played, so he's pretty much relegated to use by die hards. Add to that the fact that a player who just picks up Sion averages a 41% winrate, and he's obviously not the easiest to use.

For an infinite stacking champ, he falls off incredibly hard over the duration of a game. 

But you can't even say if he's ok or weak, because he's almost exclusively used by mains, as his gameplay has become quite unintuitive and not as satisfying as it used to be, and his playrate is so low that his numbers shift dramatically from patch to patch simply due to small sample size.

If the champion was actually good, they'd be getting played. Such as Ahri, who is still sitting at a 54% win rate as she has for the last year (yet no one seems to care...?) with a 17% pick rate. Or a tank that isn't garbage, such as Malphite's 54%/13%/27% win/pick/ban rates.

When literally no one picks them, their win rate will be skewed in one direction or another from the tiny sample size, and make it nearly meaningless. He's certainly nowhere near as bad as many champs, but when you're behind Shen support for pick rate you're pretty awful. A 52% win rate with such a tiny pick rate isn't remotely impressive; Voli's at 54% with twice the games.

Idk everyone cries for Sion buffs then there was the one time I spammed him top lane for a week straight and was wrecking 90% of my lane opponents ( i even fucked up a bad vayne) with his absurd base damages (I run armor pen in him somewhere, I swear it helps or its just a waste and I'm a scrub) and strong control. My only problem with him is the complete team reliance I required late game. my damage falls off (as it should) later game and I rely on my teammates to follow up on the charge, or to follow up on my Q. 

So you can only imagine how a Silver Sion(Although i've never tried him in ranked, I might be going against players of various brackets in a normal, seems to happen a lot) had trouble in fights. I rarely if ever found myself thinking, "Wow, this guy is weak." mostly because I had just finished wrecking my lane with little for my opponent to retaliate with. But the teamfights...its not like a buff would have even helped, it would have broke him. Sion required too much reliance from teammates who's whole mentality is "carry carry carry fk my team"...

So what I'm basically getting at is I can see how you think Sion's bad, but he's really not. He does his job fine, and well. He isn't lacking in the damage department (if you're worried about his late game damage, don't. His peel and CC is legendary when it lands and your carries focus on the damage while you protect them and get eaten alive.) or the tankiness department (the Mofo gets free HP)..

So I'm wondering, the players who claim Sion to be trash...Did you try him one game, fail, and then just give up? He's an amazing champion, and IMO he's completely balanced. Just a shame I main Yasuo(too fun!).. otherwise, I'd probably play a lot more top lane Sion.
